abilities.name: Froth
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Azumarill from your hand to evolve 1 of your Active Pokémon, you may use this power. Each Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Water Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Water Energy attached to Azumarill. This attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

abilities.name: Darkest Impulse
abilities.text: As long as Dark Ampharos is in play, whenever your opponent plays an Evolution card from his or her hand to evolve 1 of his or her Pokémon, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon. You can't use more than 1 Darkest Impulse Poké-Body each turn.

attacks.name: Shock Bolt
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy attached to Dark Ampharos.

abilities.name: Black Beam
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Dark Crobat is your Active Pokémon, you may choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon. That Pokémon is now Poisoned. This power can't be used if Dark Crobat is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Dark Drain
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Remove from Dark Crobat a number of damage counters equal to the number of your opponent's Pokémon in play.

attacks.name: Skill Dive
attacks.text: Does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Darkness Navigation
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Dark Electrode has no Energy attached to it, you may search your deck for a Darkness or Dark Metal Energy and attach it to Dark Electrode. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Dark Electrode is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Energy Bomb
attacks.text: You may move all Energy cards attached to Dark Electrode to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Shakedown
attacks.text: Choose a card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it.

attacks.name: Dark Fire
attacks.text: You may discard a Fire Energy or Darkness Energy attached to Dark Houndoom. If you do, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Dark Link
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose an attack on 1 of your Pokémon in play that has Dark in its name (excluding this one). Dark Link copies that attack except for its Energy cost. (You must still do anything else required for that attack.) (No matter what type that Pokémon is, Dark Hypno's type is still Psychic Darkness.) Dark Hypno performs that attack.

attacks.name: Black Magic
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the number of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Brick Smash
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hard Bone
attacks.text: Discard a Basic Pokémon or Evolution card from your hand or this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Black Suction Cups
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Defending Pokémon. Flip a coin. If heads, each Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Ink Blast
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Dark Octillery but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

abilities.name: Cunning
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top card of your opponent's deck. Then, you may shuffle his or her deck. This power can't be used if Dark Slowking is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Litter
attacks.text: You may discard a combination of up to 2 Pokémon Tool cards and Rocket's Secret Machine cards from your hand. If you do, this attack does 20 damage plus 30 more damage for each card you discarded.

attacks.name: Energy Link
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for an Energy card and attach it to Dark Steelix.

abilities.name: Buffer
abilities.text: If Jumpluff would be Knocked Out by an opponent's attack, flip a coin. If heads, Jumpluff is not Knocked Out and its remaining HP becomes 10 instead.

attacks.name: Energy Crush
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon.

abilities.name: Dragon Veil
abilities.text: As long as Kingdra is in play, each of your Active Pokémon has no Weakness.

attacks.name: Hyper Whirlpool
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Aqua Sonic
attacks.text: This attack's damage is not affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Sheer Cold
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, each Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Tonnage
attacks.text: You may do 60 damage plus 40 more damage. If you do, Piloswine does 30 damage to itself.

abilities.name: Holy Shield
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Togetic by your opponent's Pokémon that has Dark in its name.

attacks.name: Rainbow Moves
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon's attacks. Rainbow Moves copies that attack except for its Energy cost. (You must still do anything else required for that attack.) (No matter what type that Pokémon is, Togetic's type is still Colorless.) Togetic performs that attack.

abilities.name: Dark Trance
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Darkness Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Dark Dragonite is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Double Wing Attack
attacks.text: Does 30 damage to each Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Sticky Goo
abilities.text: As long as Dark Muk is your Active Pokémon, your opponent pays ColorlessColorless more to retreat his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Slimy Water
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of Colorless Energy in the Defending Pokémon's Retreat Cost (after applying effects to the Retreat Cost).

attacks.name: Acidic Poison
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Dark Seed
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn. Put 5 damage counters on the Defending Pokémon at the end of your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Spread Poison
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Poison Payback
abilities.text: If Dark Sandslash is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Dark Sandslash is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Grind
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Dark Tyranitar.

attacks.name: Spinning Tail
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Bite Off
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, this attack does 70 damage plus 50 more damage.

abilities.name: Sand Damage
abilities.text: As long as Dark Tyranitar is your Active Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Benched Basic Pokémon between turns. You can't use more than 1 Sand Damage Poké-Body between turns.

attacks.name: Second Strike
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has at least 2 damage counters on it, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

abilities.name: Gift Exchange
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Delibird is your Active Pokémon, you may shuffle 1 card from your hand into your deck. Then, draw a card. This power can't be used if Delibird is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Souvenir
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. If 1 of them is heads, put 4 damage counters on the Defending Pokémon. If 2 of them are heads, remove 1 damage counter from the Defending Pokémon. If all of them are heads, put 10 damage counters on the Defending Pokémon. If all of them are tails, remove all damage counters from the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Quick Change
attacks.text: Choose up to 3 cards in your hand and put them on top of your deck. Then, search your deck for that many cards and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Quick Tail Smash
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 80 damage instead. If tails, this attack does nothing.

abilities.name: Powder Protection
abilities.text: Any damage done to Ledian by attacks from Pokémon that has an owner in its name is reduced by 40.

attacks.name: Split Spiral Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Magmar from your hand onto Magby (this counts as evolving Magby), and remove all damage counters from Magby.

attacks.name: Detour
attacks.text: If you have a Supporter card in play, use the effect on that card as the effect of this attack.

abilities.name: Dark Spell
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Misdreavus is your Active Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This power can't be used if Misdreavus is affected by a Special Condition or if your other Active Pokémon is not Misdreavus.

attacks.name: Hide in Shadows
attacks.text: Switch Misdreavus with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

abilities.name: Saturation
abilities.text: When you attach a Water Energy card from your hand to Quagsire, remove all Special Conditions and 2 damage counters from Quagsire.

attacks.name: Hyper Pump
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each basic Energy card attached to Quagsire but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 60 damage in this way.

abilities.name: Spiny
abilities.text: If Qwilfish is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Qwilfish is Knocked Out), flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, put 1 damage counter on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Stun Poison
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Quick Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 4 different types of basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Swallow Up
attacks.text: Before doing damage, count the remaining HP of the Defending Pokémon and Dark Arbok. If the Defending Pokémon has fewer remaining HP than Dark Arbok's, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Extra Poison
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Super Poison Breath
attacks.text: Each Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Breaking Impact
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage for each Colorless Energy in that Pokémon's Retreat Cost (after applying effects to the Retreat Cost). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Evolutionary Light
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Dark Dragonair is your Active Pokémon, you may search your deck for an Evolution card. Show it to your opponent and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Dark Dragonair is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Double Tackle
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Crushing Blow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thunder Slash
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. Dark Flaaffy can't use Thunder Slash during your next turn.

attacks.name: Night Ambush
attacks.text: Does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Dark Golbat can't attack during your next turn. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Darkness Shield
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to each of your Active Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Cold Crush
attacks.text: You may discard an Energy card attached to Dark Golduck. If you do, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Dark Scale
abilities.text: If Dark Gyarados is your Active Pokémon and is Knocked Out by an opponent's attack, put 3 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dark Streak
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, each Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

abilities.name: Fire Breath
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Dark Houndoom is your Active Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon (choose 1 if there are 2) is now Burned. This power can't be used if Dark Houndoom is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Fire Payback
attacks.text: If you have less Benched Pokémon than your opponent, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Energy Press
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each basic Energy card attached to all of your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Magnetic Lines
attacks.text: If your opponent has at least 2 Pokémon in play, move a basic Energy card from the Defending Pokémon to another of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Poison Pulse
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Explosive Evolution
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.) Then, search your deck for a card that evolves from Dark Pupitar and put it on Dark Pupitar. (This counts as evolving Dark Pupitar.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Double Tackle
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dark Streak
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, each Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Rock Tumble
attacks.text: This attack's damage is not affected by Resistance.

abilities.name: Methane Leak
abilities.text: As long as Dark Weezing is your Active Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on each Pokémon that remains Poisoned between turns.

attacks.name: Smog
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Darkness Charge
attacks.text: Put 2 damage counters on Dark Weezing.

abilities.name: Crust
abilities.text: Any damage done to Heracross by attacks from your opponent's Basic Pokémon is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Get Even
attacks.text: If you have more Prize cards left than your opponent, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Prize card more than your opponent.

attacks.name: Dump and Draw
attacks.text: Discard up to 2 Energy cards from your hand. Then, draw 2 cards for each Energy card you discarded.

abilities.name: Ripples
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may remove 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon (excluding Mantine). This power can't be used if Mantine is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Aqua Slash
attacks.text: Mantine can't attack during your next turn.

attacks.name: Snatch and Run
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon Tool card or Rocket's Secret Machine card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. If you do, you may switch Rocket's Meowth with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Miraculous Comeback
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's). This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads. Rocket's Meowth does 10 damage times the number of tails to itself.

attacks.name: Dark Aid
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for Pokémon Tool cards and Rocket's Secret Machine cards. You may show either 1 Pokémon Tool card or Rocket's Secret Machine card to your opponent and put it into your hand, or show a combination of 3 Pokémon Tool cards or Rocket's Secret Machine cards to your opponent and shuffle them into your deck.

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Aqua Trick
attacks.text: Move 1 Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If your opponent has no Benched Pokémon, this effect does nothing.

abilities.name: Buffer
abilities.text: If Skiploom would be Knocked Out by an opponent's attack, flip a coin. If heads, Skiploom is not Knocked Out and its remaining HP becomes 10 instead.

attacks.name: Miracle Powder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 Special Condition. The Defending Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition.

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Mini-Metronome
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Mini-Metronome copies that attack except for its Energy cost. (You must still do anything else required for that attack.) (No matter what type that Pokémon is, Togepi's type is still Colorless.) Togepi performs that attack.

attacks.name: Look for Friends
attacks.text: Reveal cards from your deck until you reveal a Basic Pokémon. Show that card to your opponent and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other revealed cards into your deck. (If you don't reveal a Basic Pokémon, shuffle all the revealed cards back into your deck.)

attacks.name: Bonemerang
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Dragon Song
attacks.text: Each Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Tail Strike
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

abilities.name: Insomnia
abilities.text: Drowzee can't be Asleep.

attacks.name: Soothing Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, each Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Tail Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Taunt
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch.

attacks.name: Spit Poison
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

abilities.name: Buffer
abilities.text: If Hoppip would be Knocked Out by an opponent's attack, flip a coin. If heads, Hoppip is not Knocked Out and its remaining HP becomes 10 instead.

attacks.name: Miracle Powder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 Special Condition. The Defending Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition.

attacks.name: Water Plant
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for up to 2 Water Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

abilities.name: Dark Lift
abilities.text: If Houndour has any Darkness Energy attached to it, the Retreat Cost for Houndour is 0.

attacks.name: Firebreathing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

abilities.name: Knockout Gas
abilities.text: If Koffing is your Active Pokémon and is Knocked Out by an opponent's attack, the Attacking Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Dig Drain
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from Larvitar.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Grass Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Call for Friends
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Sonicboom
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.name: Minor Errand-Running
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Minor Errand-Running
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Horn Rush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Granite Head
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Onix by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Headache
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play a Trainer card from his or her hand until the end of your opponent's next turn.

abilities.name: Scramble
abilities.text: As long as your opponent has any Pokémon-ex as his or her Active Pokémon, the Retreat Cost for Rattata is 0.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Snarl
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to the Defending Pokémon. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Energy Draw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to Remoraid. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Friend Search
attacks.text: Look at the top 5 cards of your deck. Choose a Basic Pokémon or Evolution card you find there, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Put the other 4 cards back on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

abilities.name: Dense
abilities.text: Any damage done to Slowpoke by attacks from your opponent's Evolved Pokémon is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Heat Tackle
attacks.text: Slugma does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Rising Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Rest
attacks.text: Remove all Special Conditions and all damage counters from Swinub. Swinub is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Psycho Waves
attacks.text: Discard an Energy card attached to Voltorb. The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

abilities.name: Saturation
abilities.text: When you attach a Water Energy card from your hand to Wooper, remove all Special Conditions and 1 damage counter from Wooper.

attacks.name: Dark Streak
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, each Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

name: Copycat
rules: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw a card for each card in your opponent's hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Pokémon Retriever
rules: Search your discard pile for Basic Pokémon and Evolution cards. You may either show 1 Basic Pokémon or Evolution card to your opponent and put it into your hand, or show a combination of 3 Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards to your opponent and shuffle them into your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Pow! Hand Extension
rules: You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Rocket's Admin.
rules: Each player shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck. Then, each player counts his or her Prize cards left and draws up to that many cards. (You draw your cards first.)
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Rocket's Hideout
rules: Each Pokémon in play with Dark in its name (even your opponent's) gets +20 HP.
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

name: Rocket's Mission
rules: Discard a card from your hand. Then, draw 3 cards. If you discarded a Pokémon that has Dark or Rocket's in its name, draw 4 cards instead.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Rocket's Poké Ball
rules: Search your deck for a Pokémon with Dark in its name, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Rocket's Tricky Gym

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon. Illustrated by Ryo Ueda More formats

rules: Each Pokémon with Dark or Rocket's in its name (both yours and your opponent's) can use attacks on this card instead of its own.
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

name: Surprise! Time Machine
rules: You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Swoop! Teleporter
rules: You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Venture Bomb
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. If tails, put 1 damage counter on 1 of your Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Dark Metal Energy
rules: Attach Dark Metal Energy to 1 of your Pokémon. While in play, Dark Metal Energy provides Darkness Energy and Metal Energy, but provides only 1 Energy at a time. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card when not in play and has no effect other than providing Energy.)

abilities.name: Darkness Veil
abilities.text: As long as Rocket's Articuno ex has any Darkness Energy attached to it, prevent all effects, except damage, by an opponent's attack done to Rocket's Articuno ex.

attacks.name: Freeze Solid
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Water Energy card and attach it to Rocket's Articuno ex.

abilities.name: Dark Condition
abilities.text: As long as Rocket's Entei ex has any Darkness Energy attached to it, Rocket's Entei ex has no Weakness.

attacks.name: Energy Link
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for an Energy card and attach it to Rocket's Entei ex.

attacks.name: Volcanic Ash
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to Rocket's Entei ex and then choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 60 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Strikes Back
abilities.text: If Rocket's Hitmonchan ex is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Rocket's Hitmonchan ex is Knocked Out), put 2 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mach Punch
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Darkness Switch
attacks.text: Discard an Energy card attached to Rocket's Mewtwo ex, and then switch all damage counters on Rocket's Mewtwo ex with those on the Defending Pokémon. (If an effect of this attack is prevented, this attack does nothing.)

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

abilities.name: Dark Lift
abilities.text: If Rocket's Moltres ex has any Darkness Energy attached to it, the Retreat Cost for Rocket's Moltres ex is 0.

attacks.name: Fire Dance
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Fire Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon.

abilities.name: Dual Armor
abilities.text: As long as Rocket's Scizor ex has any Metal Energy attached to it, Rocket's Scizor ex is both Darkness and Metal type.

attacks.name: Rotating Claws
attacks.text: You may discard an Energy card attached to Rocket's Scizor ex. If you do, search your discard pile for an Energy card (excluding the one you discarded) and attach it to Rocket's Scizor ex.

abilities.name: Dual Armor
abilities.text: As long as Rocket's Scyther ex has any Grass Energy attached to it, Rocket's Scyther ex is both Grass and Darkness type.

attacks.name: Bounce
attacks.text: After your attack, you may switch Rocket's Scyther ex with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Slashing Strike
attacks.text: Rocket's Scyther ex can't use Slashing Strike during your next turn.

attacks.name: Drag Off
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with the Defending Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 10 damage to the new Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch.

attacks.name: Dark Ring
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each of your Darkness Pokémon in play.

abilities.name: Dark Healer
abilities.text: As long as Rocket's Snorlax ex has any Darkness Energy attached to it, remove 1 damage counter from Rocket's Snorlax ex between turns.

attacks.name: Poison Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Collapse
attacks.text: Rocket's Snorlax ex is now Asleep.

abilities.name: Dark and Clear
abilities.text: As long as Rocket's Suicune ex has any Darkness Energy attached to it, Rocket's Suicune ex can't be affected by any Special Conditions.

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Hyper Splash
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Stage 2 Evolved Pokémon, this attack does 50 damage plus 40 more damage.

abilities.name: Darkness Guard
abilities.text: As long as Rocket's Zapdos ex has any Darkness Energy attached to it, damage done to Rocket's Zapdos ex by an opponent's attack is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Plasma
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to Rocket's Zapdos ex.

attacks.name: Raging Thunder
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Whirlpool
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spring Back
attacks.text: If your opponent has only 1 Prize card left, this attack does 20 damage plus 50 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Fireworks
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy card attached to Torchic Star.

attacks.name: Spring Back
attacks.text: If your opponent has only 1 Prize card left, this attack does 20 damage plus 50 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Spring Back
attacks.text: If your opponent has only 1 Prize card left, this attack does 20 damage plus 50 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Fireworks
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy card attached to Charmeleon.

name: Here Comes Team Rocket!
rules: Each player turns all of his or her Prize cards face up. (Those Prize cards remain face up for the rest of the game.)
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.
